title: Ticket #4603: DAEMON_SOCKET_DIR=auto breaks partial use of shared port
description: The new DAEMON_SOCKET_DIR=auto setting breaks configurations where shared port is used by children of the master, but not the master itself. Each child daemon ends up with a different CONDOR_PRIVATE_SHARED_PORT_COOKIE value, meaning the shared port daemon uses the wrong name for the daemon's abstract socket and can't connect.
remarks:
2014-Sep-18 16:38:32 by jfrey:
Having a set of daemons where only some use shared port is inadvisable. It messes up how the master creates a command port to be inherited by a child daemon.

2014-Nov-18 14:47:52 by jfrey:
If USE_SHARED_PORT=False for the master, it shouldn't set CONDOR_PRIVATE_SHARED_PORT_COOKIE in environment of any child daemons. If they're configured to use shared port, they can fall back to using the daemon socket directory. This provides the same behavior as 8.2.x.
